feed.title: NewsTracker: egypt
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Car bombing at Italian Consulate in Egypt's capital kills 1
entry.summary: Italian Foreign Minister Paolo Gentiloni said that Italy would increase security at Italian sites in Cairo and greater Egypt.

entry.title: Car bombing at Italian Consulate in Egypt's capital kills 1
entry.summary: No group immediately claimed responsibility for the blast, though Egypt faces threats from insurgent factions including an Islamic State affiliate in its restive Sinai Peninsula that the military says killed at least 17 soldiers in a recent assault there.

entry.title: Car Bombing at Italian Consulate in Egypt's Capital Kills 1
entry.summary: A policeman stands at the base of the crumbled facade of the Italian consulate following a blast that killed at least one person in Cairo, Egypt, Saturday, July 11, 2015.

entry.title: Car bombing at Italian Consulate in Egypt's capital kills 1
entry.summary: Italian Premier Matteo Renzi spoke with Egyptian President Abdel Fattah el-Sissi after the attack, saying in a statement: "We will not leave Egypt alone: Italy and Egypt are and will always be together in the fight against terrorism."

entry.title: Omar Sharif, of "Doctor Zhivago," "Lawrence of Arabia," dies
entry.summary: Yousra, Egypt's biggest actress for much of the past 30 years and a close friend of Sharif, compared Sharif to a "clean-cut" diamond.

entry.title: 'Lawrence of Arabia' actor Omar Sharif dies at 83
entry.summary:
Sharif was Egypt's biggest box-office star when David Lean cast him in 1962's "Lawrence of Arabia," but he was a virtual unknown elsewhere.

The 1968 film was banned in his native Egypt because he was cast as a Jew.

Born Michael Shalhoub in Egypt's Mediterranean coastal city of Alexandria, Sharif was the son of Christian Syrian-Lebanese parents.

Some of Egypt's most iconic film posters are of Hamama and Sharif.

entry.title: Roadside bomb injures 20 policemen in the restive north of Egypt's Sinai
entry.summary: AL-ARISH, Egypt - Security officials say 20 policemen were injured when their bus and armored personnel carrier were hit by a roadside bomb in the turbulent north of Egypt's Sinai Peninsula.

entry.title: Egypt anti-terror bill speeds trials, tightens hand on media
entry.summary: The leaked copy of the bill brought an outcry and demands for changes in the draft from Egypt's journalists union and from senior judges.

entry.title: Egypt anti-terror bill speeds trials, tightens hand on media
entry.summary:
Since Egypt has not had a parliament for more than two years, laws are issued by the president, Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi, after going through the Cabinet.

The New York-based Committee to Protect Journalists has said that at least 18 journalists were behind bars in Egypt as of June 1 and accused the government of using the pretext of national security to crackdown on freedoms.

entry.title: Egypt's currency drops to new low against the dollar
entry.summary: CAIRO (AP) " Egypt's central bank says the Egyptian pound has fallen to a new low against the dollar, its second such drop since Thursday.

entry.title: IS in Egypt claims rocket attack on Israel
entry.summary: Egypt's military deployed F-16 warplanes to bombard IS jihadists who battled troops after launching their surprise dawn attack.

entry.title: Egypt foiled extremist 'state' in Sinai, president says
entry.summary:
It came in a week of bloodletting that saw Egypt's prosecutor general assassinated outside his Cairo home by a massive car bomb, and a special forces raid on an apartment that killed nine members of the outlawed Muslim Brotherhood.

Egypt routinely blames the Muslim Brotherhood for violent attacks in the country.

entry.title: Rockets land in Israel, Egypt's IS affiliate claims responsibility
entry.summary: Islamic State's Egypt affiliate, Sinai Province, said in a statement posted on Twitter by supporters that it had launched three Grad rockets toward "occupied Palestine".

entry.title: Egypt marks 2nd anniversary of Islamist ouster with mourning
entry.summary: Two years to the day after the army overthrew Egypt's Islamist president, the sounds coming from the mosque at Cairo's Tahrir Square were sadly telling.

entry.title: Egypt's president vows 'swift justice' after assassination
entry.summary: Despite an international outcry against legal abuses and lack of due process, Egypt has waged a 2-year-old crackdown that has led to thousands of arrests, mass convictions and death sentences.

entry.title: Egypt's Sisi promises tougher legal system as prosecutor buried
entry.summary: Western governments have criticized the mass death sentences but are unlikely to take strong measures against Egypt, seen as a vital partner for security in a region beset by turmoil.

entry.title: Egypt prepares for burial of slain prosecutor general
Egypt prepares for burial of slain prosecutor general
entry.summary: The widow of Egypt's slain chief prosecutor Hisham Barakat receives condolences from mourners who wait to take his body to his funeral in Cairo, Egypt, Tuesday, June 30, 2015.

entry.title: Fallen Egypt archaeologist wants international Grand Museum
entry.summary: His name is still associated with many of Egypt's most famous digs, including grand discoveries such as the Valley of the Golden Mummies in Bahariya Oasis in 1999 and the mummy of Queen Hatshepsut almost a decade later.

entry.title: Fallen Egypt archaeologist wants international Grand Museum
entry.summary:
For more than a decade, he was the self-styled Indiana Jones of Egypt, presiding over its antiquities and striding through temples and tombs as the star of TV documentaries that made him an international celebrity.

In this June 18, 2015 photo, Zahi Hawass, Egypt's former head of antiquities, speaks during an interview with The Associated Press in his office in Cairo.

His trademark wide-brimmed hat and safari vest may be hung up for now, but he is brimming with ideas on how to revive Egypt's antiquities and bring back tourists after years of unrest.

entry.title: Car bomb attack kills Egypt's top public prosecutor
entry.summary: Last month, the Islamic State militant group's Egyptian affiliate urged followers to attack judges, opening a new front in an Islamist insurgency in Egypt..

entry.title: Car bomb attack kills Egypt's top public prosecutor
entry.summary: Egypt's top public prosecutor was killed by a car bomb attack on his convoy on Monday, the most senior state official to die at the hands of militants since the toppling of an Islamist president two years ago.

entry.title: Bomb kills Egypt's top prosecutor as he drives to work
entry.summary:
Egypt's official news agency said Barakat has died of wounds sustained in the attack in a Cairo suburb.

Security personnel collect forensic evidence at the site of a bombing that killed Egypt's top prosecutor, Hisham Barakat, in Cairo, Egypt, Monday, June 29, 2015.

entry.title: Bomb kills Egypt's top prosecutor as he drives to work
Egyptian prosecutor killed in bomb attack
entry.summary:
CAIRO -- A bomb attack in a busy, upscale Cairo suburb targeted the convoy of Egypt's prosecutor general on Monday morning, a security official said.

The attack came as Egyptian security forces went on high alert on the eve of the second anniversary of massive anti-Islamist demonstrations that paved the way, days later, for the military's ouster of Egypt's Islamic President Mohammed Morsi.

entry.title: Car bomb kills Egypt’s top prosecutor
entry.summary: Egypt's main Islamic militant group Ansar Beit al-Maqdis - which has pledged allegiance to the Islamic State group fighting in Iraq and Syria - has claimed responsibility for that attack.

entry.title: Car bomb attack kills Egypt's top public prosecutor
entry.summary: Policemen investigate the site of a car bomb attack on the convoy of Egyptian public prosecutor Hisham Barakat near his house at Heliopolis district in Cairo, Egypt, June 29, 2015.

entry.title: Egypt sentences 3 to year in prison over racy video
Germany frees Al-Jazeera journalist sought by Egypt
entry.summary: Dozens of demonstrators gathered outside the justice building before Mansour was released, carrying signs with slogans including "stop the bloodbath in Egypt" and "freedom for Ahmed Mansour."

entry.title: Germany Frees Al-Jazeera Journalist Sought by Egypt
entry.summary: Egypt considers Al-Jazeera a mouthpiece of the Muslim Brotherhood, the Islamist group that it has labelled a terrorist organization.

entry.title: Germany frees Al-Jazeera journalist sought by Egypt
entry.summary: A dual Egyptian-British citizen, he was convicted in absentia in Egypt on charges that his lawyers and reporters' groups call politically motivated.

entry.title: Swiss drop part of case over Mubarak's still-frozen funds
entry.summary: Switzerland is dropping part of a prosecution case against Egypt's longtime autocrat Hosni Mubarak, his close aids and family members, involving hundreds of millions of Swiss francs frozen in Swiss banks.

entry.title: US delivers 2 missile ships to Egypt, says they will support security of vital waterways
entry.summary:
CAIRO - The U.S. Embassy in Cairo says America has delivered two vessels, known as fast missile craft, to Egypt's navy to help it secure vital waterways such as the Suez Canal and Red Sea.

The embassy's senior defense official, Maj. Gen. Charles Hooper, says the delivery is a sign of America's ongoing commitment to Egypt and the two countries' shared security interests in the region.

entry.title: US Delivers 2 Missile Ships to Egypt for Security Support
entry.summary:
Monday's statement on the embassy website says the ships were delivered last week in the Mediterranean port city of Alexandria, doubling Egypt's current number of such vessels.

The embassy says the total of four ships represent a $1.1 billion investment by the United States in its strategic partnership with Egypt.

entry.title: German authorities detain Al Jazeera journalist at Egypt's request
entry.summary: A high-profile Al Jazeera journalist has been arrested in Germany at the request of Egypt.

entry.title: Egypt Names Ambassador to Israel After Nearly 3 Years
entry.summary:
Egypt has named a new ambassador to Israel nearly three years after it had recalled the last one at the outset of the 2012 Israeli offensive in Gaza.

A statement released Sunday said President Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi named ambassador Hazem Khairat as part of a regular reshuffle of Egypt's diplomatic corps.

entry.title: Al-Jazeera reporter still held in Berlin on Egypt warrant
entry.summary:
"The Berlin prosecutor's office is examining the legal assistance request" from Egypt, he added.

Al-Jazeera journalist Ahmed Mansour was being held in Berlin police custody today awaiting a judge's decision on his further detention on an international arrest warrant issued by his native Egypt, authorities said.

entry.title: Bus Crashes in Egypt Kill 23, Injure 17 Others
entry.summary: The World Health Organization says traffic accidents claim the lives of about 12,000 people a year in Egypt.

entry.title: Bus crashes in Egypt kill 23, injure 17 others
Separate bus crashes in Egypt kill 23, injure 17 others
entry.summary: CAIRO - Officials say two separate road accidents in Egypt Sunday have killed 23 Egyptians and injured 17 others.

entry.title: Egypt to inaugurate Suez Canal expansion
entry.summary:
Construction work on Egypt's New Suez Canal project.

Ismailiya, Egypt: Egypt will inaugurate a "new Suez canal" shipping route in August aimed at speeding up traffic along the existing waterway and boosting revenues, officials say.

entry.title: Egypt Sentences 23 to Prison for Killing 4 Shiite Men
entry.summary: Shiites are a small minority in Egypt, which is largely Sunni.

entry.title: Egypt sentences 23 to prison for killing 4 Shiite men
Egypt's new Suez Canal to be completed for Aug 6 ceremony
entry.summary: A dredger works on a new section of the Suez canal during a media tour in Ismailia, Egypt.

entry.title: Egypt's new Suez Canal to be completed for Aug. 6 ceremony
entry.summary: "It is boosting our self-confidence and we are hoping this project will return Egypt to the path for investment."

entry.title: Egypt's Suez Canal authority says work on new waterway to meet Aug. 6 opening deadline
entry.summary:
ISMAILIA, Egypt - Egypt's Suez Canal Authority says work on a parallel waterway to allow two-way traffic on the key trade route will be finished in time for a gala inauguration on Aug. 6.

President Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi has ordered the new waterway to be dug in a single year, saying that the urgency of Egypt's economic situation meant the project could not wait for an originally planned three-year timetable.

entry.title: Egypt's new Suez Canal to be completed for Aug. 6 ceremony
Egypt opens borders with Gaza for the first time in months
entry.summary: RAFAH, Gaza Strip (AP) - Egypt opened its borders with the Gaza Strip for the first time in months Saturday, allowing Palestinians to enter and leave the isolated coastal strip.

entry.title: Egypt opens borders with Gaza for the first time in months
entry.summary:
A Palestinian family waits to cross the border into Egypt, at the Rafah crossing in the southern Gaza Strip, Saturday, June 13, 2015.

The Rafah border crossing will operate for six hours a day for the coming three days and 15,000 people Palestinians have applied to exit to Egypt, said Maher Abu Sabha, head of the Gaza side of the crossing.

entry.title: Egypt opens Rafah crossing into Gaza in sign of easing tensions
entry.summary: Gaza officials said 15,000 people had registered to travel via Rafah, including at least 3,000 patients, and hundreds of students who study in Egypt and elsewhere in the Arab world.

entry.title: Egypt opens borders with Gaza for the first time in months
entry.summary: Last month, it allowed the return of Palestinians stranded in Egypt.

entry.title: Egypt opens borders with Gaza for the first time in months
entry.summary:
Egypt has kept it mostly closed since the militant Hamas group seized control of the coastal strip in 2007.

Egypt has opened the Rafah crossing in both directions only five days this year.

entry.title: Egypt's Luxor, just emerging from tourism collapse, fears new blow after attack on temple
entry.summary: Still, "it was the first time that we get the message loud and clear, we have become a target," said Mohammed Othman, deputy chief of the travel agents association in southern Egypt.

entry.title: After attack, Egypt's Luxor fears new blow to vital tourism
entry.summary: Luxor tourism had just been starting to revive after collapsing following Egypt's 2011 uprising.
